TEI.2.document_title: Jose Antonio Mexia to Stephen F Austin, 03-27-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: José Antonio Mexia to Austin, Mexico, March 27, 1833. Informs Austin that he was elected to senate from Mexico and will further the interests of Texas.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 932-933

*div1 type="summary"* *p*José Antonio Mexia to Austin, Mexico, March 27, 1833. Informs Austin that he was elected to senate from Mexico and will further the interests of Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-27-1833">27th. March 1833*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin Esqre.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*My dear Friend. I take the pen in my hand to direct a few lines to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*: which part of the *location_mentioned*Republic */location_mentioned*I so much cherish and in which fate I am so much interested.*/p*
*p*As I told you in my previous letter, I am in the *location_mentioned*Senat of the Union*/location_mentioned* for which station I was named by two *location_mentioned*States */location_mentioned*though the valid election has been that of *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*by reason ot vicinity. You and the other *person_mentioned*friends in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* may have no doubt that *person_mentioned*Jose Antonio Mexia*/person_mentioned* will employ all the influence that he may have, in favor of those *location_mentioned*Colonies */location_mentioned*as well as to take away and destroy all the hinderances which were opposed to their improvement and prosperity by the mean and low of *person_mentioned*Bustamente's administration*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*So soon as the ordinary sesions of the *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*may begin I intend to try how a law of colonization may be issued as liberal as possible to promote by these means the increase of the population in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and its future happiness. Perhaps some memoranda that you should send me, would be useful to get myself perfectly instructed of such measures as might be adopted for the attainment of our desirable object, You know, better than any other person whatever, what *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*wants, and of course you can give me better than any body else such light as may be necessary to obtain a favourable result.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Padre Moldoon*/person_mentioned* presented himself to me a few day ago saying that he came as *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*from you and the *person_mentioned*Colonists*/person_mentioned*, to ask for the derogation of the Law of *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6th of April*/date_mentioned*. Perhaps the circumstances are not at present the best for him to obtain a good despatch, nor do I believe indeed, that you have commissioned him for any thing.*/p*
*p*You may consider me, my friend, as interested in the welfare of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*as any of its *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned*, and you may believe that I am very sorry that my political affairs prevent my going to begin my *location_mentioned*farm at Atascosito*/location_mentioned* or my *location_mentioned*house at Brazoria*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Geo. Fisher*/person_mentioned* wished with such ardour to go to his destination in *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned*, notwithstanding that I tried to persuade him not to do such a thing, that at last I had to give him a letter for your. He is gone, but I think *person_mentioned*Filisola */person_mentioned*will not let him pass farther than *location_mentioned*Matamoras */location_mentioned*because he told me before going that he would not permit him to enter *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Filisola */person_mentioned*is the best *person_mentioned*chief */person_mentioned*that you could have wished— Treat him with the same frankness with which you have treated me, and let all persons of some consideration in your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*be his friends.*/p*
*p*Our *person_mentioned*Santa Anna*/person_mentioned* has at last been elected *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*by the votes of *location_mentioned*16 States out of the 20*/location_mentioned*, of which the Union is composed. The *person_mentioned*Vice President*/person_mentioned* is*person_mentioned* Don. Valentin Gomez Farias*/person_mentioned* by the votes of *location_mentioned*U. States*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Santa Anna*/person_mentioned*, it appears, is determined not to admit the Presidency but the *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*will not admit his resignation and he will have to come up to the *location_mentioned*Capital */location_mentioned*for his inauguration.*/p*
*p*I would wish that a commission might come from *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned* composed of individuals from all the *location_mentioned*colonies*/location_mentioned*, to which I would join here as *person_mentioned*member */person_mentioned*should I was named for it, to present to the *person_mentioned*General*/person_mentioned* the most cordial compliments and good wishes, as well for the triumph attained by him against tiranny as for the good election of the *location_mentioned*Republic */location_mentioned*choicing him for his *person_mentioned*first magistrate*/person_mentioned*.—You are well aware that a public testimony of this nature would be of great convenience and perhaps useful to all interests. It would be desirable that you should come with the Commission—*/p*
*p*Pray write me by every opportunity and have the goodness to give direction to the Inclosures. Do not forget that you promised me a piece of *location_mentioned*land in your Colony*/location_mentioned* and that a promise is a debt.*/p*
*p*My compliments to our common friend *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*and to *person_mentioned*Don. Juan your Brother*/person_mentioned*, and consider toe always Your affectionate friend*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*José Antonio Mexia */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
